abstract.p: Andreas Delfs is appointed music director of St Paul Chamber Orchestra, where he is to succeed Hugh Wolff in September; Delfs, 41, is also music director of Milwaukee Symphony Orchestra and will retain that post (S)

block.p: Andreas Delfs has been appointed music director of the St. Paul Chamber Orchestra, where he is to succeed Hugh Wolff in September. Mr. Delfs, 41, is also the music director of the Milwaukee Symphony Orchestra and will retain that post.

Mr. Delfs was born in Flensburg, Germany, and joined the roster of the Flensburg Municipal Theater as a conductor when he was 17. He was a student of Christoph von Dohnanyi and Aldo Ceccato at the Hamburg Conservatory, and during his student years he conducted at the Luneburg Municipal Theater, the Hamburg University Orchestra, the Hamburg State Opera and the Bremen State Theater. He continued his studies with Jorge Mester and Sixten Ehrling at the Juilliard School, where he received his master's degree in 1984.

Andreas Delfs has been appointed music director of the St. Paul Chamber Orchestra, where he is to succeed Hugh Wolff in September. Mr. Delfs, 41, is also the music director of the Milwaukee Symphony Orchestra and will retain that post.

Mr. Delfs was born in Flensburg, Germany, and joined the roster of the Flensburg Municipal Theater as a conductor when he was 17. He was a student of Christoph von Dohnanyi and Aldo Ceccato at the Hamburg Conservatory, and during his student years he conducted at the Luneburg Municipal Theater, the Hamburg University Orchestra, the Hamburg State Opera and the Bremen State Theater. He continued his studies with Jorge Mester and Sixten Ehrling at the Juilliard School, where he received his master's degree in 1984.
Last year he brought the Milwaukee Symphony to Havana last year for concerts and master classes, in the first visit to Cuba by an American orchestra in 37 years.

Before he became music director in Milwaukee in 1997, Mr. Delfs held directorships at the Bern Opera and the Orchestre Suisse des Jeunes and was resident conductor of the Pittsburgh Symphony. He was director of the Hanover State Opera and Orchestra until last season.
